item.description:
We are pleased to offer private group Tennis Lessons for Beginner to Low Intermediate in conjuction with Braintree Continuing Adult Education. They have offered us our own private class for a great price. We recommend anyone who is a Beginner or Advanced Beginner (1.0-2.0/2.5) to seriously consider taking this class if you want to play Tennis with us this year.

Description:
Beginning/Intermediate Tennis
This class is for both beginners seeking instruction on basic techniques and intermediate players looking to refine skills. This five-session class promises a low pressure, fun environment. Explanation of rules will be given and etiquette will be discussed. Players should bring their own rackets. Balls will be provided. Class limited to 15.
Instructor: TBD
Course#3136SS (Spring) 5 Wednesdays Beginning May 26th @ 6:30-8pm @ BHS Tennis Courts

Tennis Lessons
Braintree High School - Tennis Courts
128 Town Street
Braintree, MA 02184
781-848-4000 x2251
Wednesdays, May 26th thru June 23rd
6:30-8pm
http://www.braintreea...

Event Organizers: Angela and Chandra. Chandra will be taking the class, but Angela will not be.

To register do the following:
Go to the More tab at the top of our Meetup page, then click on Files; "Tennis Lessons Reg Form - Spring 2010" in pdf format (should be there by the 20th). You can pick a copy up at our April events if you are unable to open it or we can email it to you. (Please email Event Organizer ahead of time of your need.)

DROP-OFF:
There is a drop-off box inside the front entrance (on the left) at Braintree High School. If doors are locked, a security guard will let you in. Enclose your registration form and payment in an envelope and address it to Community Continuing Education. Braintree High School hours are 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.
IN PERSON:
Stop by the Braintree Community Continuing Education office at Braintree High School. The office is diagonally across from Rm. 101. Regular office hours are 6:00 p.m. to 8:30 p.m., Monday through Thursday.
BY MAIL: please make checks payable to Town of Braintree. Mail to: Community Continuing Education, Braintree High School, 128 Town Street, Braintree, MA 02184.

Duration of class: 1 hour and 30 minutes. Every Wednesday for 5 weeks, starting May 26th

Recommended Attire:
Wear comfortable exercise clothing and sneakers. Dress in layers as it can be chilly at BHS and you will want to shed layers as you warm-up.

Fees: $75 per person for 5 weeks for all SSFMG Members (The $5 non-resident fee has been waived for our Group.)

Minimum/maximum attendance: Minimum of 8 people and maximum of 15 people (excluding organizers). While we are opening this up to one guest per member we do ask that you allow members the opportunity to sign-up first.

Registration deadline and to get $ to Braintree HS: Thu, May 13th at 3pm. After that time please email or contact an organizer directly. ~ Deadline is now [TODAY,] Monday, May 17th @ 8:30pm. ~

How to RSVP: RSVP Yes. Please note in your RSVP Comments once you have dropped off or mailed in your registration. Once your registration has been submitted you will automatically be enrolled in the class. The next step is to show up and have fun!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Directions are posted in the "Directions to Frequently Used Venues" Discussion Thread (DT) on the Message Board (MB).
